sentence.text: In silico human gene expression analysis confirmed the down regulation of PrKD1 in metastatic prostate cancer correlated inversely with the expression of MAX, but not MYC, and positively with negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II, a competing heterodimer of MAX, suggesting that the dimerization of MAX with either MYC or MXD1 regulates PrKD1 gene expression.

entity.text: negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II

sentence.text: Because we had demonstrated that protein phosphorylation is the only known kinase to phosphorylate threonine 120 (T120) of beta-catenin in prostate cancer resulting in increased nuclear beta-catenin, we explored the role of beta-catenin in gene regulation of PrKD1.
Down regulation of Protein Kinase D1 (protein phosphorylation), a novel serine threonine kinase, in prostate, gastric, breast and colon cancers in humans leads to disease progression.
